summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2008 PONTIAC GRAND PRIX.  WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH AFTER PURCHASING THE VEHICLE, THE PAINT BEGAN PEELING.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE FAILURE WAS CAUSED BY EXPOSURE TO ACID RAIN AND THEY OFFERED TO RE-PAINT THE VEHICLE.  THE CONTACT ALSO FELT A HARD VIBRATION WHEN DEPRESSING THE BRAKE PEDAL AND ACCELERATING TO 55-65 MPH.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 400 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 800.
